application.text: Applicant is completing Application to Lease or Rent as a (check one) tenant, tenant with co-tenant(s) or guarantor/co-signor.
APPLICATION TO LEASE OR RENT/SCREENING FEE (LRA PAGE 1 OF 3)

If application is not fully completed, or if section II, 2 is applicable and the application is received without the full screening fee: (i) the application will not be processed, and (ii) the application and any portion of the screening fee paid will be returned.

Applicant understands and agrees that: (i) this is an application to rent only and does not guarantee that applicant will be offered the Premises; (ii) Housing Provider may receive more than one application for the Premises and, (iii) Applicant will provide a copy of applicant's driver's license or other acceptable identification upon request.
Return your completed application and any applicable fee not already paid to:

Applicant represents the above information to be true and complete, and hereby authorizes Housing Provider to: (i) verify the information provided; and (ii) obtain a credit report on applicant and (iii) obtain an “Investigative Consumer Report” (“ICR”) on and about applicant.
Housing Provider acknowledges receipt of this entire Application to Lease or Rent/Screening Fee.

X  Applicant shall pay a nonrefundable screening fee of $45.00  per applicant, directly to Housing Provider, applied as follows: (Civil Code Section 1950.6 sets the maximum screening fee that can be charged, as adjusted annually by the Consumer Price Index.

If 2B is selected, and the application is received without the full screening fee: (i) Housing Provider will notify Applicant, (ii) the application will not be processed, and (iii) the application and any portion of the screening fee paid will be returned.
Applicant will provide screening information and fee directly to Housing Provider's authorized screening service at: .
Applicant shall provide Social Security Number/Tax Identification Number to Housing Provider.
APPLICATION TO LEASE OR RENT/SCREENING FEE (LRA PAGE 3 OF 3)

Such number shall be provided upon request from Rental Property Owner, Authorized Broker or Agent, or Property Manager ("Housing Provider").
APPLICATION TO LEASE OR RENT/SCREENING FEE (LRA PAGE 1 OF 3)

Applicant understands and agrees that: (i) this is an application to rent only and does not guarantee that applicant will be offered the Premises; (ii) Housing Provider may receive more than one application for the Premises and, (iii) Applicant will provide a copy of applicant's driver's license or other acceptable identification upon request.
Applicant further authorizes Housing Provider to disclose information to prior, current, or subsequent owners and/or agents with whom applicant has had, or intends to have, a rental relationship.

X  Applicant shall pay a nonrefundable screening fee of $45.00  per applicant, directly to Housing Provider, applied as follows: (Civil Code Section 1950.6 sets the maximum screening fee that can be charged, as adjusted annually by the Consumer Price Index.
Applicant will provide screening information and fee directly to Housing Provider's authorized screening service at: .
Applicant shall provide Social Security Number/Tax Identification Number to Housing Provider.
APPLICATION TO LEASE OR RENT/SCREENING FEE (LRA PAGE 3 OF 3)

With respect to any investigative consumer report from an investigative consumer reporting agency (“CRA”), the Landlord may investigate the information contained in your rental application and other background information about you, including but not limited to obtaining a criminal report, eviction report, verifying references, work history, your social security number, and other information about you, and interviewing people who are knowledgeable about you.
The Landlord agrees to provide you with a copy of an investigative consumer report when required to do so under California law.

NOTICE REGARDING BACKGROUND INVESTIGATION REPORTS PURSUANT TO CALIFORNIA LAW

Question 1.question: what happens after the application to rent is completed?
Question 1.statement: After the application to rent is completed, the applicant understands and agrees that the application is not a guarantee that they will be offered the premises. The housing provider may receive multiple applications and the applicant may be required to provide identification upon request. The housing provider will acknowledge receipt of the application and, if applicable, the screening fee. If the application is received without the full screening fee, the housing provider will not process the application and will return the application and any part of the screening fee paid. The landlord may also investigate the information contained in the rental application and other background information about the applicant. If the Landlord is required to provide the applicant with a copy of an investigative consumer report under California law then they will do so. The completed application and applicable fees should be returned to the address provided by the housing provider.

Question 2.question: how will my information be used?
Question 2.statement: Your personal information will be used to verify your identity and provide information about your financial information, which includes other income information. The CRA will provide trained personnel to explain any information furnished to you and will provide a written explanation of any coded information contained in files maintained on you. Your credit report and an "Investigative Consumer Report" will also be obtained by the housing provider. Such reports may include information about your character, general reputation, personal characteristics, and mode of living. "Proper Identification" includes documents such as a valid driver's license, Social Security account number, military identification card, and credit cards. If you cannot identify yourself with such information, the CRA may require additional information concerning your employment and personal or family history in order to verify your identity.

Question 3.question: what information will the background report include?
Question 3.statement: The background report may include information about your character, general reputation, personal characteristics, and mode of living. Additionally, the landlord may investigate information contained in your rental application and other background information about you, including but not limited to obtaining a criminal report, eviction report, verifying references, work history, your social security number, and other information about you, and interviewing people who are knowledgeable about you. The report may also be an investigative consumer report or consumer credit report, and the source of the investigative consumer report will be disclosed. The results of this report may be used as a factor in making housing decisions. The CRA will provide trained personnel to explain any information furnished to you, and they will provide a written explanation of any coded information contained in files maintained on you.
